channel.title: BuddyTV
channel.description: BuddyTV - TV News, Spoilers, Pictures, Profiles, Forums, and Live Commentary

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' Week 2: Dorothy Hamill Bows Out
item.description:
Tuesday night's results show was filled with dancing, drama, and technical difficulties. Besides the first dancing pair being sent home on season 16 of Dancing with the Stars the show also featured an encore dance and some awkward live moments.

I'm sure producers wanted to start the show off with a bang and they tried by getting right to the results. They announced the first few teams that were safe as well as on of the teams that would be in jeopardy of being sent home later. There was only one problem; none of the teams could hear the hosts as they read the results.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Justified' Recap: Ellen May is Protected, But is Winona?
item.description:
After last week's incredible episode -- one of the series' best, I think -- it's tough to follow-up with an episode as gripping and entertaining. Last week felt like a season finale, whereas this episode, entitled "Peace of Mind," feels like an epilogue at times. But it does contain quite the twist -- a sharp jog to the side which hints at a very, very dark set-up for a later episode.

"Peace of Mind" opens with Raylan happier than we've ever seen him. Winona shares with him that their child is going to be a girl, and even though Raylan says he doesn't "know sh*t about girls," he seems genuinely cheerful as he enters the marshal's office to rapturous applause.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Dance Moms' Recap: A Broadway Star Directs Gold Diggers
item.description: The Abby Lee Dance Company gets an extra helping of star power this week in the form of Rachelle Rak, a scrappy professional dancer with Broadway credits and years of experience. Rak's star may be shiny, but she's not above helping the ALDC craft a winning number. The Flashdance performer is a personal friend of Abby's, so she lends her teaching skills and hairography to the ALDC with pleasure, polishing the group dance, "Gold Digger," with Fosse-caliber choreography. It's too bad Abby doesn't fully appreciate her friend's contributions.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Hell's Kitchen' Recap: Unsportsmanlike Cooking
item.description:
There are only 17 chefs still holding on to their knives tonight on Hell's Kitchen. After last week's cliffhanger, Jeremy's fate still lingers. What will Chef Ramsay reveal?

It's all about sports tonight as famed Olympians enter the dining room. Will the chefs keep up wit the pack or will they fall short of the coveted gold medal?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' Results: The First Elimination of the Season
item.description:
Now that everyone's had a chance to perform, it's time to get to the "competition" part of this celebrity dance competition: one famous amateur dancer is leaving tonight. Going in, my money's squarely on the arrhythmic and seemingly unpleasant D.L. Hughley, though I wouldn't be terribly surprised if Real Housewife Lisa Vanderpump were to make an early exit either.

Let's find out who's first to go:
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Voice' Recap: An 'American Idol' Finalist Makes a Team
item.description: The Voice kicked off season 4 Monday night with plenty of terrific singers and a solid debut for new coaches Usher and Shakira. After two hours of Shakira's sweetness and Usher's leg kicked up on the ledge of his chair, I was left thinking "Cee Who and X-what-a?'
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Vampire Diaries' Video Sneak Peek: Rebekah and Katherine Meet in 'American Gothic'
item.description: The Vampire Diaries leaves Mystic Falls again on "American Gothic." The search for the cure has gone from the mysterious island, to New York City, and now Pennsylvania. Rebekah and Elena head to the west in order to find Katherine and the cure.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revolution': 25 Shocking Moments from 'The Stand'
item.description:
Revolution returned with an explosive premiere that included helicopter attacks, rocket launchers, and a renewed war between the Monroe Republic and the rebels.

Two sons were lost. One was beaten, abandoned and killed via a lie, while the other was shot down by a helicopter following his heroic act to save the rebels.

Check out the shocking moments from "The Stand."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Following': 24 Eye-Opening Moments from 'Guilt'
item.description:
The Following "Guilt" was filled with both shocking and revealing pivotal moments. Joe showed off his powers of persuasion, while conflicts arose among his Followers. Claire and Ryan were finally honest with each other before she made the decision to stop the killing and go to her son. And, the FBI may have lost Claire, but they found an integral cult asset.

Check out some of the eye-opening moments from "Guilt."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Best 'Castle' Quotes from 'The Wild Rover'
item.description: A murder forces Ryan to go back undercover with the Irish mob and making the team wonder if he'll make it back safely. Check out the best quotes from Castle "The Wild Rover."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Pretty Little Liars' Picked Up for Season 5, Gets Spin-Off: 'Ravenswood'
item.description:
Today marks the first Tuesday without Pretty Little Liars in a long time. And after the season 3 finale, the show left fans wanting more. So many twists and turns and reveals and mystery that our heads are still spinning.

Today ABC Family announced via twitter that Pretty Little Liars is getting its own spin-off, Ravenswood. The show will premiere this October, following the Pretty Little Liars annual Halloween special.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Best 'Bones' Quotes from 'The Blood from the Stones'
item.description: The Smithsonian team finds a body packed with diamonds, leading Booth and Brennan to an engagement ring store and a documentary filmmaker to the lab. Check out the best quotes from Bones "The Blood from the Stones."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Monday Ratings: 'Voice' Return Crushes the Competition
item.description: NBC was hoping and praying that the return of The Voice (and, to a lesser extent, Revolution) would save its recent ratings woes, and it looks like those prayers have been answered.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Real Housewives of Atlanta': Kordell Stewart Files for Divorce
item.description: After less than two years of marriage, and one season on The Real Housewives of Atlanta, Kordell Stewart is filing for divorce from Housewives star Porsha Stewart.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly of 'The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills' Season 3
item.description: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills season 3 finale has aired and now our favorite privileged ladies are re-opening every wound and rehashing every memory during the always much-anticipated reunion. We?ve decided to take our own look back at the best and worst of times that occurred in yet another unforgettable season.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: ?Dancing with the Stars? Week 2 Performance Rankings
item.description: Ranking the best and worst performances from week 2 of Dancing with the Stars season 16.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Nashville' Exclusive Interview with Charles Esten: Many Challenges Ahead for Deacon
item.description: Nashville continues this week after a short hiatus, with an episode called "When You're Tired of Breaking Other Hearts." BuddyTV spoke to star Charles (though he said he prefers "Chip") Esten at this month's Paleyfest event
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'NCIS' Episode 10.19 Preview: McGee Faces His Daddy Issues
item.description: NCIS season 10 continues on Tuesday, March 26 with an episode called "Squall." Check out the episode synopsis and preview videos below to see what happens when a case reunites McGee with his father.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revolution' Interview: EP Eric Kripke Discusses the Premiere's Shocking Death
item.description: For a show that's supposed to be about a world without electricity and limited guns, the Revolution spring premiere was surprisingly explosive. Rachel's decision to give Monroe the amplifier had far-reaching consequences that she never could have foreseen or she would have died first.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' Week 2 Results Prediction: Vanderpump Does Not Rule
item.description:
For the first time on season 16 of Dancing with the Stars a contestant is being sent home. On Monday night's episode there were some good performances, bad performances and ugly performances. Will the worst dancing team get eliminated tonight on "Prom Night?"

Unfortunately you never know who the fans will vote for. If tonight's Dancing with the Stars results show was based on performance we would already know who lost (D.L. Hughley), but a big part of the show is a pair's likeability.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Following' Recap: Love and Betrayal on 'Guilt'
item.description: On The Following, Joe had one goal: finding Claire and reuniting their family. On "Guilt," despite the efforts of the FBI and Ryan Hardy, Claire willingly gave herself up to Joe's Followers in order to be reunited with her son, but only after she and Ryan declared their love for each other.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revolution' Recap: Charlie Loses Another Loved One
item.description: Four months after the mid-season finale, Revolution returns for the rest of its intriguing first season with tonight's spring premiere. In tonight's eleventh episode, "The Stand," Monroe's reign of terror reaches new heights thanks to his newly-powered weapons. Can Team Charlie stop Monroe before it's too late? Read on to find out if the mid-season opener lives up to expectations.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Bates Motel' Recap: Norma's First Son Threatens to Ruin Everything
item.description: Norma's eldest son arrives in White Pine Bay. The police question Norma about the disappearance of the motel's previous owner. A mysterious accident proves the picturesque town has an ugly side. Norma becomes closer to one of the town's residents. Let's jump into this episode of Bates Motel.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Castle' Recap: Ryan's Surprising Past Uncovered
item.description: This week on Castle, we take a step away from our main players to spend some time learning about Detective Ryan. And man, has Ryan been holding out on us! Our favorite mild-mannered snappy dresser has a past with the Irish mob. It turns out if you take Ryan out of his signature three-piece suit, he has the capacity to be a pretty dangerous dude.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Voice' Season 4 Premiere Recap: Ushering in a New Shak-year-a
item.description: Welcome back, fans of spinning chairs, people who point at themselves and Carson Daly! It's The Voice season 4, and I'm very happy to return for another year of recapping the best singing show on TV. Sorry American Idol, but if you think Lazaro Arbos is one of the eight best singers in the country, we've got a problem.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com
